channel.title: blender Eğitimi on
channel.description: Recent content in blender Eğitimi on

item.title: Blender'ı kullanmaya başlama
item.description: Selam Dünya! (Ayriyeten) # # not all of this is required, but just here for reference bl_info = { "name": "Hello World", # name of the add-on "author": "Blender developer", # name of the author "version": (1, 0), # version number for the add-on "blender": (2, 78, 0), # version of Blender the add-on is compatible with "location": "Space > Hello World", # where the user can find the add-on "description": "Greets something", # add-on description "warning": "Beta version", # whatever the user needs to be warned about "wiki_url": "", # documentation link "category": "Development", # add-on category } # the blender python module import bpy # this is just for convenience - could just use as bpy.

item.title: Blender'da Programlamaya Başlarken
item.description: Blender kaynak kodunun çoğu C ve C++ ile yazılırken, Uzantılar (Eklentiler) tamamen Python’da kodlanmıştır. Blender > 90 uzantı kurulu olarak gelir, ancak tümü varsayılan olarak etkinleştirilmez. Blender uzantıları, Kullanıcı Tercihleri ​​penceresi aracılığıyla kurulur ve etkinleştirilir (“Dosya” menüsünden veya “Ctrl + Alt + u” kısayoluyla erişilebilir). Selam Dünya! (Ayriyeten) # # not all of this is required, but just here for reference bl_info = { "name": "Hello World", # name of the add-on "author": "Blender developer", # name of the author "version": (1, 0), # version number for the add-on "blender": (2, 78, 0), # version of Blender the add-on is compatible with "location": "Space > Hello World", # where the user can find the add-on "description": "Greets something", # add-on description "warning": "Beta version", # whatever the user needs to be warned about "wiki_url": "", # documentation link "category": "Development", # add-on category } # the blender python module import bpy # this is just for convenience - could just use as bpy.
